contents.contents: It's been two years since The Slash of the Dice was first submitted to the GMTK Game Jam 2022 following the theme "Roll of the Dice". Since then, I've been working on overhauling and improving a majority of the game's features to make it even better than its game jam counterpart. Today, I finally release this version that's been in the works for almost two years.
Complete Menu Overhaul
The original menu was essentially just a list. That's boring and difficult to navigate. Combined with certain features being impossible on that system, I decided to rework the entire menu.
With a design made by TotallyNotFrisk, this menu aims to improve the overall user experience and make the game more visually appealing.

contents.caption: The new menu is a significant improvement over the old design

contents.contents: Player Customization
Another big feature of 1.2 is the new player customization options. You can now change the player's color, trail, death effect, and hat.
I'd like to thank MichaelEpicA for implementing most of the customization features.
Achievements
Why not have more reasons to play the game? There are now many achievements for you to unlock, some being extremely simple and others requiring some significant dedication.
Playtest Support
A big thanks to the 1.2 beta playtesters for helping spot and fix issues before release:
EastCoastBraiden
nicholas
MichaelEpicA
And thank you
for reading this, and I hope you have fun!
Here's to another two years!

title: VoltRhythm v0.1.1-alpha has been released

contents.contents: Sorry this version took 5 months!! I've just been quite busy with other work (and also mildly demotivated, hooray).
But, finally, v0.1.1-alpha is here... and is much larger than I would like a patch version to be, whoops!
Additions
There are several major additions in this "patch" version:

contents: A new border, "Spooky Pumpkins," has been added. (This version was released two days before Halloween, after all)
You can now play VoltRhythm using a gamepad.
The keybinds menu is now populated with much more than just the lane keybinds.
Don't like the backgrounds in the charts? You can now turn them off.

contents.contents: Changes
Some changes were made to improve readability and interaction:

contents: Songs that only have one difficulty will no longer display the arrows (↕) in the song select.
Accuracy displays now have 2 more decimal places of precision. (98% → 98.35%)
When remapping keybinds, if you press nothing for 5 seconds, it will return to what it was previously.
Some phrasing has been adjusted.
You can now rename your profiles in the profiles menu.

contents.contents: Fixes
A game is not a game without bugs. The following bugs were fixed:

contents: Error handler crashes due to incorrect font path
Some note types don't display properly if the normal note's width is different
Editor is too fast if shift was held when exiting playtest mode
BPM field in Song Metadata panel in chart editor doesn't work
The "freeze_view" effect crashes the game
Song select freezes the game if custom song disk only has overvolt
Game crashes if chart uses more than 4 lanes
